entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 40 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 12 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jetpack (Improved)
entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 50 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 14 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jetpack (Superior)
entries: Jetpacks are personal aerial transportation devices that allow the operator to fly into and through the air with great mobility. Activating or deactivating the jetpack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 60 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 16 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Jug
entries: A jug stores 1 gallon of liquid.

item.name: Karrak
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d3 when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains 2d3 temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a d3 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d3. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (Fine)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d4 when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains 2d4 temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a d4 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d4. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (High Quality)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d8 when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains 2d8 temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a d8 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d8. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (Potent)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d10 when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains 2d10 temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a d10 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d10. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (Pure)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d12 when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains 2d12 temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a d12 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d12. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Constitution throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Karrak (Uncut)
entries: A powerful painkiller, karrak allows creatures to continue through the most grievous injuries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d6 when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains 2d6 temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a d6 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d6. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Keen Beam
entries: This weapon gains the keen 1 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Beam (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 2 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Beam (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 3 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases to 3.

item.name: Keen Core
entries: This weapon gains the keen 1 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Core (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 2 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Core (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 3 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases to 3.

item.name: Keen Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the keen 1 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Oscillator (Deadly)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 2 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Keen Oscillator (Devastating)
entries: This weapon gains the keen 3 property. If it already has the keen property, its keen number increases to 3.

item.name: Krayt Dragon Pearl (Flawless)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls you make with force powers when using this weapon as your focus. If the power would damage multiple targets, you can only apply this damage bonus to one of them.

item.name: Krayt Dragon Pearl (Perfect)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, you gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls you make with force powers when using this weapon as your focus. If the power would damage multiple targets, you can only apply this damage bonus to one of them.

item.name: Krayt Dragon Pearl (Regular)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls you make with force powers when using this weapon as your focus. If the power would damage multiple targets, you can only apply this damage bonus to one of them.

item.name: Lambent Shielding
entries: This shield gains the lambent property.

item.name: Leg Reinforcements
entries: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

item.name: Light Cell
entries: This weapon gains the light property.

item.name: Light Core
entries: This weapon gains the light property.

item.name: Light Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the light property.

item.name: Lightning Cannon
entries: Whenever you deal damage with this weapon and roll the maximum on the weapon damage die, the creature hit becomes shocked until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Lightning Rifle
entries: Whenever you deal damage with this weapon and roll the maximum on the weapon damage die, the creature hit becomes shocked until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Lightweapon Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable lightweapon chassis comes with vacant modification slots for lightweapon modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Lightweight Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the lightweight property.

item.name: Lightweight Stabilizer Frame
entries: This weapon loses the two-handed property.

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Lore increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Lore increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Lore increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in Lore.

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Lore increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Loremaster's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Lore increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Machinist's Catalyzer Mk I
entries: As an action, you can administer this catalyzer to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +1 bonus to its damage and healing rolls with tech powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one catalyzer at a time.

item.name: Machinist's Catalyzer Mk II
entries: As an action, you can administer this catalyzer to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +1 bonus to its tech attack rolls, tech save DC, and damage and healing rolls with tech powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one catalyzer at a time.

item.name: Machinist's Catalyzer Mk III
entries: As an action, you can administer this catalyzer to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +2 bonus to its tech attack rolls, tech save DC, and damage and healing rolls with tech powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one catalyzer at a time.

item.name: Machinist's Catalyzer Mk IV
entries: As an action, you can administer this catalyzer to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +3 bonus to its tech attack rolls, tech save DC, and damage and healing rolls with tech powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one catalyzer at a time.

item.name: Macrobinoculars
entries: Macrobinoculars are handheld viewing devices that allow users to observe distant objects. Some models are able to see into space from the surface of a planet.

item.name: Mag-lock Boots
entries: While you wear these boots, you can activate or deactivate heir mag-locks as a bonus action. While the mag locks are engaged, you move at half speed, can walk on any solid metallic surface, ignore difficult terrain caused by metallic debris, and ignore the effects of gravity (or the lack thereof), allowing you to walk up vertical surfaces or even upside-down.   The battery in these boots lasts for a total of 1 hour and recharges at the end of a long rest.

item.name: Magnetic Forearm Enhancement
entries: This augmentation replaces a forearm.  Unarmed strikes with this hand have the reach property.  {@b Side Effect:} When you roll a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with this arm, the hand disconnects and falls to the ground. It can be picked up and replaced as a bonus action.  {@i This hand replacement creates a magnetic connection between the hand and forearm, emitting a minor hum.}

item.name: Magnetic-Lock Grip
entries: While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to disarm or avoid being disarmed.

item.name: Magnetized Shield
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 13 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Champion)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 18 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases to 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Exceptional)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 17 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Fine)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 14 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Improved)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 15 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Magnetized Shield (Superior)
entries: This shield gains the magnetic 16 property. If it already has the magnetic property, its magnetic number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Manageability Armoring
entries: This armor loses the bulky property.

item.name: Mancatcher
entries: When you would make a Strength (Athletics) check to attempt to grapple a creature while wielding a weapon with the grappling property, you can instead make a melee weapon attack with it. If the attack hits, the creature becomes grappled by you, and it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier of the same type as the weaponâ€™s damage.

item.name: Mandalorian Beskar'gam
entries: This armor comes equipped with 24 slots that can each hold a single item that weighs less than 2 lb. Additionally, it grants a +1 bonus to AC.  {@b {@i Mandalorian Vestments.}} While wearing and attuned to this armor and Mandalorian Helmet, you are able to survive and operate in zero gravity space and other dangerous conditions. Additionally, this armor now grants a +2 bonus to AC, instead of +1. While wearing and attuned to this armor, Mandalorian Helmet, and Mandalorian Shuk'orok, this armor now grants a +3 bonus to AC, instead of +2.  {@i This armor is forged from an incredibly rare material known as beskar, a highly durable metal.}

item.name: Mandalorian Helmet
entries: This helmet comes equipped with a headcomm and holorecorder. Additionally, while wearing this helmet, you have darkvision out to 60 feet.   {@b {@i Mandalorian Vestments.}} While wearing and attuned to this helmet and Mandalorian Beskar'gam, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight within 60 feet. While wearing and attuned to this helmet, Mandalorian Beskar'gam, and Mandalorian Shuk'orok, you have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks within 5 feet.  {@i Featuring the iconic T-shaped visor of the Mandalorians, this helmet strikes fear into the hearts of the unwary.}

item.name: Mandalorian Shuk'orok
entries: While wearing these gloves, your Strength score becomes 21. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 21, it has no effect on you.  {@b {@i Mandalorian Vestments.}} While wearing and attuned to these gloves and Mandalorian Beskar'gam, these gauntlets no longer count towards your maximum attunement. While wearing and attuned to these gloves, Mandalorian Beskar'gam, and Mandalorian Helmet, you have resistance to kinetic and energy damage from unenhanced sources.  {@i The final piece of a Mandalorian's armor, these gauntlets grant augmented strength.}

item.name: Manipulator Upgrade
entries: You lose the Undersized special trait.

item.name: Mantle of the Anomic
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your sentinel level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When you would use a Force-Empowered Self option, you can expend charges instead of force points.  When you reach 5th level in sentinel, you can use two Force-Empowered Self options per hit, instead of only one.  When you reach 11th level in sentinel, you can use each Force-Empowered Self option twice per turn, instead of only once. You can still only use each option once per hit.  When you reach 17th level in sentinel, you can use your Enlightened Evasion feature for any saving throws, instead of just against effects that deal damage.  {@i This visually unremarkable mantle resists effects that would cause it to move or make noise.}

item.name: Maser Core
entries: When a creature tries to reduce the damage of a shot from this weapon with a feature or power, such as monk's Deflect Missiles or the {@i saber reflect} force power, they have disadvantage on the reduction roll.

item.name: Matrix Armor
entries: While wearing this suit of armor, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.  {@i This suit of armor has had its protective durasteel components replaced by equivalents made of matrix, a purple metal used to reinforce starships.}

item.name: Mechanic
entries: As an action, you can activate the repair tools, choosing one of the following options: - You can stabilize a droid within 5 feet of you that has 0 hit points, without needing to make an Intelligence (Technology) check. - You can restore 2d4+2 hit points to a droid or construct within 5 feet.  You can use each feature once. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.  {@i This part equips the droid with a series of machine repair tools.}

item.name: Mechanic's kit
entries: Mechanic's kits are used to craft and repair vehicles and starships.

item.name: Medic
entries: As an action, you can activate the medical kit, choosing one of the following options: - You can stabilize a creature within 5 feet of you that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check. - You can restore 1d4+1 hit points to a creature within 5 feet. - You can cure a target of one poison affecting them or to give them advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour.  This medical kit has no effect on droids or constructs. You can use each feature once. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.  {@i This part equips the droid with a compact medical kit.}

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Medicine increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Medicine increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Medicine increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in Medicine.

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Medicine increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Medic's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Medicine increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Medpac
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls one die equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Champion)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls six dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Exceptional)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls five dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Fine)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls two dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Improved)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls three dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point) If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Medpac (Superior)
entries: A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore hit points to a beast or humanoid within 5 feet. The creature rolls four dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: MerenData Excelcior
entries: When you deal cold damage to a creature with a tech power cast through this wristpad, the creature gains 1 slowed level until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Mesh armor
entries: Providing solid protection for a minimal cost, mesh armor is considered excellent protection for entrenched troops or guards. However, this protection comes at a cost of mobility, limiting its uses by rapidly advancing infantry. Still, it provides more mobility than battle armor.

item.name: Mess kit
entries: This box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

item.name: Microphasic Hypervisor
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes.  You can activate or deactivate this implant as a bonus action. While active, you have truesight to a range of 30 feet.  {@b Side Effect:} While active, you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks beyond 30 feet.  {@i This augmentation is a large, boxy eye replacement that covers both eyes with digital optic feeds and high resolution sensors.}

item.name: Mighty Athlete Package
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength saving throws.  {@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Strength (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.  {@i This implant drastically increases your physical capacities.}

item.name: Mighty Build
entries: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

item.name: Mighty Core
entries: This weapon gains the mighty property.

item.name: Mine, Corrosive (Average)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 4d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, Corrosive (Deadly)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 8d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, Corrosive (Devastating)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 12d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, Corrosive (Lethal)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 10d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, Corrosive (Major)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 6d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, Cryo (Average)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 4d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one.   Additionally, on a failed save, a creature gains 1 slowed level for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Mine, Cryo (Deadly)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one.   Additionally, on a failed save, a creature gains 1 slowed level for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Mine, Cryo (Devastating)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. item.name: Mine, Gas (Average)
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, the mine fills the air in a 15-foot-radius sphere with yellow-green fog for 1 minute. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of at least 10 miles per hour disperses it.  When a creature enters the fog or starts its turn there, it creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 4d6 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is poisoned while it is in the cloud. Droids, constructs and humanoids wearing appropriate protective equipment are unaffected.

entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is stunned until the end of their next turn.  Additionally, on a failed save, a creature is unconscious for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Mine, corrosive
entries: Mines can be set to detonate when a creature comes within up to 15 feet of it or paired with a remote detonator. As an action, you can prime and set a mine on a surface you can reach, which arms at the start of your next turn. When detonated, each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 2d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything unenhanced it is wearing or carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.

item.name: Mine, cryo
entries:

Additionally, on a failed save, a creature gains 1 slowed level for 1 minute. At the end of an affected creature's turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Missile, Fragmentation (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced wrist launcher ammunition, which deals 1d6 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, hit or miss, the missile then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

item.name: Monk Defensive Augment
entries: You gain one Monastic Vow option.

item.name: Monk Offensive Augment
entries: When you roll a 1 on the damage roll for an unarmed strike or monk weapon, you can reroll the die. You must use the new roll.

item.name: Monomolecular Oscillator Mk I
entries: This weapon ignores resistance to kinetic damage.

item.name: Monomolecular Oscillator Mk II
entries: This weapon ignores resistance to kinetic damage, and treats immunity as resistance.

item.name: Mortar Launcher
entries:
Rather than traditional power cells, the mortar launcher fires grenades. If you lack proficiency in the mortar launcher, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total. A mortar launcher cannot fire on targets within its short range and when firing a grenade at long range, creatures within the radius of the grenadeâ€™s explosion do not have advantage on the saving throw. Additionally, when you launch a mortar at a target, you can treat the Weapon's point of origin as being 200ft in the air for the purposes of determining line of sight and cover.

The mortar launcher requires the use of a tripod, which is included in the price. Over the course of 1 minute, you can deploy or collapse the mortar launcher on the tripod. While deployed, your speed is reduced to 0.

item.name: Multispectral Optics (Champion)
entries: While looking through this weapon's scope, you have truesight out to a distance equal to the long range of this weapon and you can see creatures that are lightly or heavily obscured. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls.

item.name: Mummergy
entries: Mummergy is a strong-smelling liquor derived from a plant of the same name. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d3 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a d3 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Mummergy (Aged)
entries: Mummergy is a strong-smelling liquor derived from a plant of the same name. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d8 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a d8 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d4 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a d4 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Munitions kit
entries: Munitions kits are used to create ammunition for blasters, as well as devices to hone lightweapons and vibroweapons.

item.name: Muon Gold (Fine)
entries: Muon gold is a lubricant-based spice that gives users intensified mental clarity and focus for a short time. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum tech points by 2d4. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum tech points are reduced by 2d4. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Nagai Edge (Basic)
entries: When you have advantage on an attack roll you make with this weapon, get the same result on both dice rolls, and hit, you deal one additional weapon die worth of damage.

item.name: Nagai Edge (Exceptional)
entries: When you have advantage on an attack roll you make with this weapon, get the same result on both dice rolls, and hit, you deal three additional weapon dice worth of damage.

item.name: Nagai Edge (Improved)
entries: When you have advantage on an attack roll you make with this weapon, get the same result on both dice rolls, and hit, you deal two additional weapon dice worth of damage.

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Nature increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Nature increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Nature increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in Nature.

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Nature increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Naturalist's Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Nature increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Necklace of Determination
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your monk level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. When you would expend a focus point, you can instead expend a charge.  When you reach 5th level in monk, when you use your Slow Fall feature, the amount is increased to ten times your monk level, instead of five.  When you reach 11th level in monk, when you use your Deflect Missiles feature, you can add your Wisdom or Charisma modifier to the roll (your choice, a minimum of +1).  When you reach 17th level in monk, you can add half your Dexterity modifier (rounded down) to your focus save DC and focus attack modifier.  {@i This simple necklace comprised of a series of tiny gray beads hosts a single pale blue crystal that glows faintly.}

item.name: Needler
entries: The needler includes a specialized compartment for poison. One dose of poison, when installed in this compartment, retains its potency for 1 hour before drying. One dose of poison is effective for the next 10 shots fired by the weapon.

item.name: Net
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The net has an AC of 10, 5 hit points, and immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons. Destroying the net frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the net's effects. While a creature is restrained by a net, you can make no further attacks with it.

item.name: Net (Champion)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The net has an AC of 15, 30 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the net frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the net's effects. While a creature is restrained by a net, you can make no further attacks with it.

item.name: Net (Exceptional)
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on formless or Huge or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 17 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The net has an AC of 14, 25 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the net frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the net's effects. While a creature is restrained by a net, you can make no further attacks with it.

item.name: Nighthawk Ocular Implant
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes.  You can activate or deactivate this implant as a bonus action. While active, you gain darkvision to a range of 120 feet.  {@b Side Effect:} While active and in bright light, you have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

item.name: Novanian Grog (Aged)
entries: This grog features a pungent odor and a strong kick. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum tech points by 2d8. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, their current and maximum tech points are reduced by 2d8. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Obscured Armoring

item.name: Operative Defensive Augment

item.name: Operative Offensive Augment
entries: Your Sneak Attack damage die increases by one step (from d6 to a d8, d8 to d10, or d10 to d12).

item.name: Optimized Actuators Mk I

item.name: Orbalisk Armor
entries: This armor has no weight and does not affect encumbrance. While wearing it, you are considered proficient regardless of whether or not you have proficiency with heavy armor, and you are resistant to all unenhanced damage.  {@b {@i Cursed.}} You can not remove this armor without first killing the orbalisks. While wearing this armor, whenever you complete a long rest, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. You can choose to fail this saving throw. For each saving throw you fail, the size of your Hit Die is reduced by one step (from d12 to d10, from d10 to d8, from d8 to d6, from d6 to d4, or from d4 to d2). If you fail a saving throw while your Hit Die is a d2, you die as the orbalisks consume you. Additionally, for each saving throw you fail, your AC increases by 1. For each saving throw you succeed, the size of your Hit Die increases by one step (from d2 to d4, from d4 to d6, from d6 to d8, from d8 to d10, or from d10 to d12). Additionally, for each saving throw you succeed, your AC decreases by 1. The size of your Hit Die can not exceed the Hit Dice granted by your class, and your AC can not be increased or reduced more than the number of Hit Die increases or reductions.   {@i This armor is comprised of a series of small parasitic creatures called orbalisks. Over time, orbalisks reproduce until they cover the entirety of their host.}

entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Pauldron of Retribution
entries: This item can hold a number of charges equal to half your berserker level (rounded up). When you complete a long rest, this item regains all missing charges. While raging, when you deal damage that would include your Rage Damage, you can expend one charge to double your Rage Damage bonus for that damage.  When you reach 5th level in berserker, when you use your Reckless Attack feature, your critical hit range increases by 1.  When you reach 11th level in berserker, once per critical hit, when you roll maximum damage on a weapon damage die, you can roll an additional die and add both to the total.  When you reach 17th level in berserker, when you are conscious and fail a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw, you can choose to instead succeed. Once you've done so, you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.  {@i This single pauldron, which can be worn over armor, features the visage of a howling beast.}

item.name: Perceptive Pattern (Basic)

item.name: Perceptive Pattern (Choice)

item.name: Perceptive Pattern (Exquisite)

item.name: Perceptive Pattern (Favored)

item.name: Personal translator
entries: A personal translator is a hand held device that can translate verbal communications between up to five languages. The languages can be changed out while interfaced with a protocol droid or appropriate computer.

item.name: Phobium Echoer (Improved)
entries: When you cast a force power that affects an area in a radius or a cube, you can increase the radius or length of the cube by 5 feet.

item.name: Phobium Echoer (Superior)
entries: When you cast a force power that affects an area in a radius or a cube, you can increase the radius or length of the cube by 10 feet.

item.name: Physical Barrier Mk I
entries: As an action, you can administer this barrier to a creature within 5 feet. The barrier has 10 hit points, and lasts 8 hours. Whenever the creature takes damage (one of energy, ion, or kinetic, chosen by the GM when the item is created), the barrier takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, the creature takes any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Physical Barrier Mk II
entries: As an action, you can administer this barrier to a creature within 5 feet. The barrier has 20 hit points, and lasts 8 hours. Whenever the creature takes damage (one of energy, ion, or kinetic, chosen by the GM when the item is created), the barrier takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the barrier to 0 hit points, the creature takes any remaining damage. A creature can benefit from only one barrier at a time.

item.name: Pocket scrambler
entries: A pocket scrambler is a simple add-on to any commlink that automatically encodes any messages sent out. The transmitted message can only be read by a device equipped with a matched scrambler.

item.name: Poison
entries: As an action, you can use the poison in this vial to coat one vibroweapon, one slug cartridge, or one wrist launcher dart. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 2d4 poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

item.name: Portable Teleporter Mk I
entries: As an action, you can use this teleporter to create a pair of linked portals: one portal appears in a space within 5 feet of you, and the other portal appears in an unoccupied space you can see up to 30 feet away. These portals lasts until the start of your next turn, and they are large enough to accommodate Medium and smaller creatures and objects. Portals take the appearance of an elongated, shimmering mirror, and looking through a portal, a creature can see through the linked portal as if looking through a window. A creature or object who passes through a portal immediately appears in a space within 5 feet of the linked portal.

item.name: Pot
entries: A pot stores 1 gallon of liquid.

item.name: Pouch
entries: A pouch stores 6.00 lb., not exceeding 1/5 cubic foot.

item.name: Power Cell (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Cell (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Cell (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d10 damage with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Cell (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d8 damage with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Cell (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced power cell. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power cell is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Generator (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d10 damage with this enhanced power generator. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power generator is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Generator (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d8 damage with this enhanced power generator. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Generator (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced power generator. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power generator is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Power Supply Port
entries: You gain the ability to charge expended power cells and power generators within your reach. You have a charging capacity of 1 hour. You can spend 10 minutes of this charging capacity to replenish an expended power cell, or 1 hour replenishing an expended power generator. Alternatively, you can directly connect to and power a single blaster weapon that uses power cells or power generators. Once per turn, if the powered weapon would be reloaded, it can be done without using an action, instead expending 10 minutes of your charging capacity if it uses power cells or 1 hour if it uses a power generator. Connecting or disconnecting a weapon takes an action.   If you attempt to replenish an enhanced power cell or power generator, or a specialized power cell, it loses its enhanced or specialized properties.

item.name: Power belt
entries: This belt has slots to hold six power cells, and can be connected to directly power a single blaster weapon that uses power cells. Once per turn, if the powered weapon would be reloaded, it can be done without using an action using any ammunition in the belt. Connecting or disconnecting a weapon takes an action. Replacing an expended power cell takes an action.

item.name: Power cell
entries: Weapons with this property are fueled by power cells, which must be loaded in order to fire the weapon.

item.name: Power generator
entries: Power generators energize the rotary cannon.

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk I
entries: This armor gains the powered 11 property. If it already has the powered property, its powered number increases by one step (from 11 to 13, 13 to 15, 15 to 17, 17 to 19, or 19 to 21).

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk II
entries: This armor gains the powered 13 property. If it already has the powered property, its powered number increases by two steps (from 11 to 15, 13 to 17, 15 to 19, or 17 to 21).

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk III

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk IV

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk V

item.name: Powered Armoring Mk VI
entries: This armor gains the powered 21 property. If it already has the powered property, its powered number increases to 21.

entries: This weapon's range increases by 20/80.

item.name: Processing Amplifier (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Processing Amplifier (Fighting)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Processing Amplifier (Mastery)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Processing Amplifier (Training)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee tech attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Processing Rangefinder (Dueling)
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Projector Canister, Corrosive (Average)
entries: When triggered, this enhanced wrist launcher ammunition produces a spray of acid in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 acid damage, and the first attack it makes before the end of its next turn has disadvantage. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't disadvantaged. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. If you lack proficiency in the wrist launcher, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

On a failed save, a creature takes 3d4 cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.

It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

item.name: Projector canister, corrosive
entries: When triggered, this wrist launcher ammunition produces a spray of acid in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 acid damage, and the first attack it makes before the end of its next turn has disadvantage. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't disadvantaged. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. If you lack proficiency in the wrist launcher, you have disadvantage on damage rolls with it

item.name: Projector canister, cryo
entries: When triggered, this wrist launcher ammunition produces a beam of carbonite energy in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d4 cold damage and gains 1 slowed level until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't slowed. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour. If you lack proficiency in the wrist launcher, you must roll the damage dice twice and take the lesser total.

item.name: Projector canister, incendiary
entries: When triggered, this wrist launcher ammunition produces a burst of flame in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone. item.name: Propulsion pack
entries: Propulsion packs enhance underwater movement. Activating or deactivating the propulsion pack requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a swimming speed of 30 feet. The propulsion pack lasts for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 10 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Quantum Splitter Mk I
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a d4 and add the result to the total.

item.name: Quantum Splitter Mk II
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a d6 and add the result to the total.

item.name: Quantum Splitter Mk III
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a d8 and add the result to the total.

item.name: Quantum Splitter Mk IV
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a d10 and add the result to the total.

item.name: Quick Savant Package
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Intelligence saving throws.  {@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Intelligence (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.  {@i This implant drastically increases your mental capacities.}

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Sleight of Hand increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Sleight of Hand increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Sleight of Hand increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in Sleight of Hand.

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Sleight of Hand increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Quick-Fingered Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Sleight of Hand increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Quiver
entries: A quiver which can hold up to 20 arrows, 10 bolts, or 10 darts. Drawing an item from the quiver does not require an object interaction.

item.name: RZ-3 Extender Frame
entries: This weapon gains the reach property.

item.name: Raava
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d3 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a d3 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Aged)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d8 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a d8 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Fine)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d4 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a d4 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Matured)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d6 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a d6 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Reserve)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d10 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a d10 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Raava (Special)
entries: Raava is a traditional liquor breed from zsajhira berries. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d12 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, during which they must roll a d12 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Dexterity. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Ram, portable
entries: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

item.name: Ranging Dataport (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the ranging 3 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases to 3.

item.name: Ranging Dataport (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the ranging 1 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Ranging Dataport (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the ranging 2 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Ranging Emitter (Ascendancy)
entries: This item gains the ranging 3 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases to 3.

item.name: Ranging Emitter (Fighting)
entries: This item gains the ranging 1 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Ranging Emitter (Mastery)
entries: This item gains the ranging 2 property. If it already has the ranging property, its ranging number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Rapid Core
entries: This weapon gains the rapid property, with a rapid number equal to one-half its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the rapid property, the rapid number is reduced to one-fourth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Rapid Core (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the rapid property, with a rapid number equal to one-eighth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the rapid property, the rapid number is reduced to one-sixteenth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Rapid Core (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the rapid property, with a rapid number equal to one-fourth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2. If it already has the rapid property, the rapid number is reduced to one-eighth its reload number (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.

item.name: Reactive Armoring
entries: This armor gains the reactive 1 property. If it already has the reactive property, its reactive number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Reactive Armoring Mk II
entries: This armor gains the reactive 2 property. If it already has the reactive property, its reactive number increases by 2, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Reactive Armoring Mk III
entries: This armor gains the reactive 3 property. If it already has the reactive property, its reactive number increases to 3.

item.name: Reactive Ultrachrome Armor
entries: You have resistence to unenhanced damage while you wear this armor. Additionally, you can use an action to make yourself immune to unenhanced damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this special action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.  {@i Made with just enough ultrachrome to give you an edge while still keeping things interesting, these suits of armor can discharge an integrated power cell to catalyze this metal normally used in starship hulls into a more resilient state.}

item.name: Recoil Dampener
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the strength number is 11, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Champion)
entries: This weapon loses the strength property.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Exceptional)
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the strength number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Fine)
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the strength number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Improved)
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the strength number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Recoil Dampener (Superior)
entries: This weapon's strength number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the strength number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the strength property from it entirely.

item.name: Reflex Enhancer Mk I
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Intelligence saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.  {@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Intelligence saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Reflex Enhancer Mk II
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.  {@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Reflex Enhancer Mk III
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity or Intelligence saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.  {@b Side Effect:} When you fail a Dexterity or Intelligence saving throw, you treat the damage as if the source had rolled the maximum.

item.name: Reflex Protocol Mk I
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Intelligence saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Reflex Protocol Mk II
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Reflex Protocol Mk III
entries: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity or Intelligence saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on a saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

item.name: Regulated Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the regulated property.

item.name: Reinforced Armoring
entries: This armor gains the reinforced property.

item.name: Reinforced Chassis
entries: You've reinforced your chassis. When you don't have armor integrated, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

item.name: Reinforced Underlay (Basic)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against ranged attacks and a -1 penalty to AC against melee attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Reinforced Underlay (Fine)
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Reinforced Underlay (Improved)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Reinforced Underlay (Superior)
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to AC against ranged attacks while wearing this armor or wielding this shield.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Champion)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to 12 mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 1,000 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Exceptional)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to ten mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 300 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Fine)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to four mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 60 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Improved)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to six mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 90 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote Detonator (Superior)
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to eight mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 150 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Remote detonator
entries: A small handhold device with a single button, used to activate explosives. Over the course of 1 minute, you can pair the detonator with up to two mines within 10 feet. As an action, you can remotely detonate all of the paired mines. You must be within 30 feet of the mines to detonate them.

item.name: Repair Kit Mk II
entries: A repair kit included the basic tools needed to repair a droid after being damaged in combat. The kit has three uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to restore hit points to a droid or construct within 5 feet. The creature rolls two dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

item.name: Repair Kit Mk III
entries: A repair kit included the basic tools needed to repair a droid after being damaged in combat. The kit has three uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to restore hit points to a droid or construct within 5 feet. The creature rolls three dice equal to the size of their Hit Die and regains hit points equal to the amount rolled + their Constitution modifier (minimum of one hit point). If the creature has Hit Dice of different sizes, use whichever Hit Die size they have the most of.

entries: This wristpad has the repelling and constitution 11 properties.

item.name: Repulsor Lifts (Basic)
entries: Repulsor lifts are a form of rocket propulsion affixed to the lower part of a droid's chassis. Activating or deactivating the repulsors requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 25 feet. The repulsor lifts last for 1 minute. Once they've been used, they can't be used again until an hour has passed.

item.name: Repulsor pack
entries: Repulsor packs are used to slow descent from a high elevation. Activating or deactivating the repulsor pack requires a bonus action and, while active, your rate of descent slow to 60 feet per round, and you ignore the effects of wind of less than moderate speed (no more than 10 mph). The repulsor pack lasts for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 10 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Resourceful Drive
entries: Your speed increases by 5 feet, and you gain proficiency in one blaster or vibroweapon of your choice.

item.name: Respiration Facilitator
entries: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against force powers.  {@i This choker allowed the notorious bounty hunter Cad Bane to bypass normal respiratory function. While worn, it gives your a voice a deeper, digital sound.}

item.name: Respirator
entries: A respirator, or breath mask, is a portable device that allowed an oxygen-breather to survive in low-oxygen atmospheres. Although not suitable for use in outer-space, these hands-free masks were essential equipment for deep-space travel that might require activity outside of a starship.

item.name: Responsive Shielding Mk I
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield} This shield gains the responsive 1 property. If it already has the responsive property, its responsive number increases by 1, to a maximum of 3.

item.name: Responsive Shielding Mk II
