item.name: Responsive Shielding Mk III
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield} This shield gains the responsive 3 property. If it already has the responsive property, its responsive number increases to 3.

item.name: Restraining Bolt (Champion)
entries: Restraining bolts are small, cylindrical devices that can be affixed to a droid in order to limit its functions and enforce its obedience. When inserted, a restraining bolt restricts the droid from any movement its master does not desire, and also forced it to respond to signals produced by a hand-held control unit.  Installing a restraining bolt takes 1 minute. The droid must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. A hostile droid makes this save with advantage. On a successful save, the restraining bolt overloads and is rendered useless. On a failed save, the restraining bolt is correctly installed, and the control unit can be used to actively control the droid. While the control unit is inactive, the droid can act freely but it can not attempt to remove the restraining bolt.

item.name: Retrosaber
entries: The retrosaber is an ancient type of lightweapon that requires a power cell to function. Once four attacks have been made with a retrosaber, a character must replace the power cell using an action or bonus action. You must have one free hand to replace the power cell.

item.name: Returning Weapon Guard
entries: This weapon gains the returning property.

item.name: Returning Weapon Hilt
entries: This weapon gains the returning property.

item.name: Reverse-Engineered Crushgaunts
entries: Your Strength score is 19 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is already 19 or higher.  {@i Though the knowledge to forge a pair of true} shuk'orok {@i is a closely-guarded Mandalorian secret, the effects of these gloves are desirable enough to spawn numerous imitators.}

item.name: Ring of Adept Force Storing
entries: This ring stores force powers cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The ring can store up to 6 levels worth of force powers at a time. When found, it contains 1d7 - 1 levels of stored force powers chosen by the GM.  Any creature can cast a force power of 1st through 6th level into the ring by touching the ring as the force power is cast. The force power has no effect, other than to be stored in the ring. If the ring can't hold the force power, the force power is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the force power determines how much space it uses.  While wearing this ring, you can cast any force power stored in it. The force power uses the slot level, force save DC, force attack bonus, and forcecasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the force power. The force power cast from the ring is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

item.name: Rocket Boots (Champion)
entries: Rocket boots are a form of rocket propulsion system affixed to a pair of boots instead of being worn on the back like a standard jetpack. Activating or deactivating the boots requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 50 feet. The rocket boots last for 1 minute and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cell.

Activating or deactivating the boots requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 35 feet. The rocket boots last for 1 minute and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cell.

item.name: Rocket Boots (Superior)
entries: Rocket boots are a form of rocket propulsion system affixed to a pair of boots instead of being worn on the back like a standard jetpack. Activating or deactivating the boots requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 40 feet. The rocket boots last for 1 minute and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cell.

item.name: Rocket Launcher
entries: Rather than traditional power cells, the rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets. When firing a rocket at long range, or if you donï¿½t meet the rocket launcherï¿½s strength requirement, creatures within the radius of the rocketï¿½s explosion have advantage on the saving throw.

item.name: Rocket Rifle
entries: Rather than traditional power cells, the rocket rifle fires specialized projectiles in the form of small missiles.

item.name: Rocket boots
entries: Rocket boots are a form of rocket propulsion system affixed to a pair of boots instead of being worn on the back like a standard jetpack. Activating or deactivating the boots requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 25 feet. The rocket boots last for 1 minute and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

item.name: Rocket, Fragmentation (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced rocket launcher ammunition, which deals 2d6 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the rocket is fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, hit or miss, the rocket then explodes. The target and each creature within 15 feet must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d10 kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

item.name: Rocket, Fragmentation (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced rocket launcher ammunition, which deals 2d6 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the rocket is fired, it no longer gives a bonus. Additionally, hit or miss, the rocket then explodes. The target and each creature within 15 feet must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d10 kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

The target and each creature within 15 feet must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 12d10 kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

The target and each creature within 15 feet must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d10 kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

item.name: Rocket, Incendiary (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced rocket launcher ammunition, which deals 2d6 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Additionally, hit or miss, the rocket then explodes, setting the ground beneath it in a 15 foot radius ablaze for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d8 fire damage or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.

The target and each creature within 15 feet must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 ion damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. item.name: Rocketpack
entries:
Rocketpacks combine the aerial transportation of a jetpack with the firepower of a rocket launcher. Activating or deactivating the rocketpack's flight capabilities requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 25 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 5 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.

Additionally, your rocketpack comes with an integrated rocket launcher with the Ammunition (range 100/400) and reload 1 properties. Rather than traditional power cells, this rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets. Whenever you would make a ranged weapon attack, you can instead fire this rocket launcher. When firing a rocket at long range, creatures within the radius of the rocket's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. Reloading this rocket launcher takes 1 minute.

item.name: Rocketpack (Champion)
entries: Rocketpacks combine the aerial transportation of a jetpack with the firepower of a rocket launcher. Activating or deactivating the rocketpack's flight capabilities requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 50 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 10 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.  Additionally, your rocketpack comes with an enhanced integrated rocket launcher with the Ammunition (range 100/400) and reload 1 properties. Rather than traditional power cells, this rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets. Whenever you would make a ranged weapon attack, you can instead fire this rocket launcher. When firing a rocket at long range, creatures within the radius of the rocket's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. Reloading this rocket launcher takes 1 minute. You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d10 damage with this enhanced rocket launcher.

item.name: Rocketpack (Exceptional)
entries: Rocketpacks combine the aerial transportation of a jetpack with the firepower of a rocket launcher. Activating or deactivating the rocketpack's flight capabilities requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 45 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 9 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.  Additionally, your rocketpack comes with an enhanced integrated rocket launcher with the Ammunition (range 100/400) and reload 1 properties. Rather than traditional power cells, this rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets. Whenever you would make a ranged weapon attack, you can instead fire this rocket launcher. When firing a rocket at long range, creatures within the radius of the rocket's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. Reloading this rocket launcher takes 1 minute. You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d8 damage with this enhanced rocket launcher.

item.name: Rocketpack (Fine)
entries: Rocketpacks combine the aerial transportation of a jetpack with the firepower of a rocket launcher. Activating or deactivating the rocketpack's flight capabilities requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 6 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.  Additionally, your rocketpack comes with an enhanced integrated rocket launcher with the Ammunition (range 100/400) and reload 1 properties. Rather than traditional power cells, this rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets. Whenever you would make a ranged weapon attack, you can instead fire this rocket launcher. When firing a rocket at long range, creatures within the radius of the rocket's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. Reloading this rocket launcher takes 1 minute. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced rocket launcher.

item.name: Rocketpack (Improved)
entries: Rocketpacks combine the aerial transportation of a jetpack with the firepower of a rocket launcher. Activating or deactivating the rocketpack's flight capabilities requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 35 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 7 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.  Additionally, your rocketpack comes with an enhanced integrated rocket launcher with the Ammunition (range 100/400) and reload 1 properties. Rather than traditional power cells, this rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets. Whenever you would make a ranged weapon attack, you can instead fire this rocket launcher. When firing a rocket at long range, creatures within the radius of the rocket's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. Reloading this rocket launcher takes 1 minute. You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced rocket launcher.

item.name: Rocketpack (Superior)
entries: Rocketpacks combine the aerial transportation of a jetpack with the firepower of a rocket launcher. Activating or deactivating the rocketpack's flight capabilities requires a bonus action and, while active, you have a flying speed of 40 feet. The jetpack last for 1 minute per power cell (to a maximum of 8 minutes) and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cells.  Additionally, your rocketpack comes with an enhanced integrated rocket launcher with the Ammunition (range 100/400) and reload 1 properties. Rather than traditional power cells, this rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets. Whenever you would make a ranged weapon attack, you can instead fire this rocket launcher. When firing a rocket at long range, creatures within the radius of the rocket's explosion have advantage on the saving throw. Reloading this rocket launcher takes 1 minute. You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced rocket launcher.

item.name: Rylith Power Core
entries: When you take the Attack action and hit a target with a ranged attack with this weapon, you can repeat the attack against another creature up to 15 feet from the target in a direct line from you (no action required). Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Sack
entries: A sack stores 30 ounces, not exceeding 1 cubic foot.

item.name: Scholar Defensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional discovery. When you complete a long rest, you can change this discovery for a different option available to you.

item.name: Scholar Offensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional maneuver, and you gain one additional superiority die.

item.name: Scout Defensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional Scout Routine option, and the radius of your Scout Routines increases by 5 feet.

item.name: Scout Offensive Augment
entries: You can apply the additional damage from your Ranger's Quarry feature one additional time per turn.

item.name: Security Spike (Champion)
entries: When you make an Intelligence (security kit) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check, and then you can reroll both of the dice once. You can wait until after you roll the d20 before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Security Spike (Fine)
entries: When you make an Intelligence (security kit) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check. You can wait until after you roll the d20 before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Security Spike (Superior)
entries: When you make an Intelligence (security kit) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to gain advantage on the check, and then you can reroll one of the dice once. You can wait until after you roll the d20 before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Security kit
entries: Security kits are used to bypass physical locks.

item.name: Security spike
entries: When you make an Intelligence (security kit) check, you can use the spike (no action required) to reroll the check. You must use the new roll. You can wait until after you roll the d20 before deciding to use the spike, but you must decide before the GM says whether the check succeeds or fails.

item.name: Semiauto Core
entries: This weapon loses the auto property.

item.name: Sentinel Defensive Augment
entries: You gain an additional manifestation use of your Sentinel Ideals.

item.name: Sentinel Offensive Augment
entries: You learn an additional Sentinel Ideal option.

item.name: Sentry
entries: You learn the {@i alarm} tech power. You can cast it once, without the use of a wristpad and without spending tech points, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for this power.  {@i This part equips a droid with a small rotating sensory dish.}

item.name: Sentry Gun
entries: Before firing the sentry gun, you must deploy it using an action unless you meet its strength requirement. Alternatively, if youâ€™re able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this action replaces one of them.  While deployed in this way, you treat this weaponâ€™s strength number as two steps less (from 19 to 15), your speed is reduced by half, and you cannot fire this weapon at long range. You can collapse the sentry gun as an action or bonus action.

item.name: Serrated Edge Mk I
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a d4 and add the result to the total.

item.name: Serrated Edge Mk II
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a d6 and add the result to the total.

item.name: Serrated Edge Mk III
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a d8 and add the result to the total.

item.name: Serrated Edge Mk IV
entries: When you deal damage with this weapon, you can roll a d10 and add the result to the total.

item.name: Shield (Champion)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wielding this shield. Additionally, while wielding this shield, damage you take is reduced by 2. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

item.name: Shield (Exceptional)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wielding this shield. Additionally, while wielding this shield, damage you take is reduced by 1. If this would reduce the damage to 0, the damage is instead reduced to 1.

item.name: Shield (Fine)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wielding this shield.

item.name: Shield (Improved)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to AC while wielding this shield.

item.name: Shield (Superior)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to AC while wielding this shield.

item.name: Shield Amplifier
entries: You modify this shield generator to project outward. As a bonus action you can amplify this shield until the start of your next turn. Each creature within 5 feet of you gains a bonus to AC equal to this shield's bonus.  You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses when you complete a short or long rest.

item.name: Shield Anchor
entries: This shield gains the anchor property.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Artifact)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of artifact rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Legendary)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as two augment slots. It can house modifications of legendary rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Premium)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications. It can house modifications of premium rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Prototype)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of prototype rarity or lower.

item.name: Shield Chassis (Standard)
entries: This modifiable shield chassis comes with vacant modification slots for armor modifications. It can house modifications of standard rarity.

item.name: Ship Armor (Fine)
entries: Your ship has a +1 bonus to AC while this armor is installed.

item.name: Ship Armor (Improved)
entries: Your ship has a +2 bonus to AC while this armor is installed.

item.name: Ship Armor (Superior)
entries: Your ship has a +3 bonus to AC while this armor is installed.

item.name: Ship Shield (Fine)
entries: Your ship has a +1 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws while this shield is installed.

item.name: Ship Shield (Improved)
entries: Your ship has a +2 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws while this shield is installed.

item.name: Ship Shield (Superior)
entries: Your ship has a +3 bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws while this shield is installed.

item.name: Ship Weapon (Fine)
entries: Your ship has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced ship weapon.

item.name: Ship Weapon (Improved)
entries: Your ship has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced ship weapon.

item.name: Ship Weapon (Superior)
entries: Your ship has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced ship weapon.

item.name: Shock Arm
entries: You have a small integrated droid shock arm with which you can make unarmed strikes. You have proficiency in this shock arm, which is a vibroweapon with the reach property and deals 1d6 lightning damage on a hit. You can use your choice of Strength or Intelligence for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.  {@i This small robotic appendage has a fork-like prod from that can release a substantial electrical discharge.}

item.name: Shock gloves
entries: A shock glove is a type of armored glove that is coated with a webbed lacing. When used for an attack, this webbing carries a charge that deals 1d4 lightning damage to any objects that the glove come in contact with. If you are engaged in combat with the target of the attack, you must make a grapple check instead of an attack roll, using a Strength (Athletics) check contested by the target's Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (the target chooses the ability to use).

item.name: Shocking Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 13 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk II
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 14 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk III
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 15 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk IV
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 16 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk V
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 17 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Shocking Oscillator Mk VI
entries: This weapon gains the shocking 18 property. If it already has the shocking property, its shocking number increases to 18.

item.name: Shortbow
entries:
Rather than traditional power cells, the shortbow fires specialized projectiles in the form of arrows. You can make a ranged weapon attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one arrow. 

Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

item.name: Shotgun Axe
entries: You have a +1 to damage rolls made with this shotgun. Additionally, this shotgun has an axe attachment, allowing you to make a melee weapon attack with it. The axe is a melee weapon that you are proficient with, and deals 1d8 kinetic damage.  Additionally, when you use this shotgun as an improvised weapon, you are considered proficient in it, and it deals 1d8 kinetic damage on a hit.  {@i "Oh you want clever? Come a little closer, I'll get real clever."}

item.name: Shoulder Blaster
entries: Mounted by the shoulder slot, a shoulder blaster does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon
entries: Mounted by the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Champion)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d10 damage with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (20, +6) property.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Exceptional)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d8 damage with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (19, +5) property.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Fine)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (16, +2) property.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Improved)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (17, +3) property.

item.name: Shoulder Cannon (Superior)
entries: Mounted in the shoulder slot, a shoulder cannon does not require a free hand to use. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of this weapon. You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced shoulder cannon, which has the smart (18, +4) property.

item.name: Siege Weapon
entries: You modify this weapon to be more effective against barriers. The weapon deals double damage against structures.

item.name: Sienar Starfire X-Force Mk I
entries: When you spend tech points to cast a tech power that restores hit points to a creature, the creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the number of tech points spent.

item.name: Sienar Starfire X-Force Mk II
entries: When you spend tech points to cast a tech power that restores hit points to a creature, the creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to twice the number of tech points spent.

item.name: Silencer
entries: This weapon gains the silent property.

item.name: Silent Armoring
entries: This armor gains the silent property.

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Deception increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Deception increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Deception increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in Deception.

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Deception increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Silver-Tongued Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Deception increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Sith Acolyte's Robe
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls with weapons and force powers while you wear this robe.  {@i Designed for those who relish personal combat, and know that power comes to those who take it, these robes augment offensive capabilities with no hindrance to movement.}

item.name: Sith Lord's Robe
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage rolls with weapons and force powers while you wear this robe.  {@i Designed for those who relish personal combat, and know that power comes to those who take it, these robes masterfully augment offensive capabilities with no hindrance to movement.}

item.name: Sith Strength Belt
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score becomes 27. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 27, it has no effect on you.  {@i Worn on the legs, waist and lower back, this belt massively increases a users physical power with a set of heavy durasteel actuators alongside an synaptic monitoring system that reacts to its users motion with optimized power responses.}

item.name: Sith Warrior's Robe
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with weapons and force powers while you wear this robe.  {@i Designed for those who relish personal combat, and know that power comes to those who take it, these robes greatly augment offensive capabilities with no hindrance to movement.}

item.name: Skills Enhancement Package
entries: When you make an ability check using a skill you are proficient in, you can roll a d4 and add the result to your total.   {@b Side Effect:} When you make an ability check using a skill you are not proficient in, you must roll a d4 and subtract the result from the total.  {@i This implant includes a library of situational information that it injects directly into your consciousness.}

item.name: Slicer's kit
entries: Slicer's kits can bypass computerized defenses and locks.

item.name: Slipstream Kickers
entries: While you wear these boots, you can use a bonus action to activate or deactivate their overdrive mode. If you do, you gain the effect of the {@i tactical advantage} tech power for 1 minute. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d10 damage with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls and deal an additional 1d8 damage with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug Cartridge (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced slug cartridge. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the slug cartridge has been fired, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Slug cartridge
entries: Weapons with this property fire slug cartridges, which must be loaded in order to fire the weapon.

item.name: Smart Interface (Basic)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (15, +2) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +1 and +1, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smart Interface (Champion)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (20, +6) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase to 20 and +6, respectively.

item.name: Smart Interface (Exceptional)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (19, +5) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +5 and +4, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smart Interface (Fine)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (16, +2) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +2 and +1, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smart Interface (Improved)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (17, +3) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +3 and +2, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smart Interface (Superior)
entries: This weapon gains the smart (18, +4) property. If it already has the smart property, its smart numbers increase by +4 and +3, respectively, to a maximum of 20 and +6.

item.name: Smugglepack
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 15.00 lb., not exceeding 1/2 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 5 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 15 Investigation check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Champion)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 10 lb., not exceeding 1/2 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 10 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 30 Investigation check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Exceptional)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 11 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 9 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 27 Investigation check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Fine)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 14 lb., not exceeding 1/2 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 6 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 18 Investigation check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Improved)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 13 lb., not exceeding 1/2 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 7 lb., not exceeding 1/4 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 21 Investigation check.

item.name: Smugglepack (Superior)
entries: This backpack comes with a main compartment that stores 12 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Additionally, it has a hidden storage compartment that stores 8 lb., not exceeding 3/8 cubic foot. Finding the hidden compartment requires a DC 24 Investigation check.

item.name: Snare
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is restrained until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 10, 5 hit points, and immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Champion)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is restrained until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 15, 30 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Exceptional)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is restrained until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 14, 25 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Fine)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is restrained until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 14 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 11, 10 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Improved)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is restrained until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 12, 15 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Snare (Superior)
entries: When hit by this wrist launcher ammunition, a Medium or smaller creature is restrained until it is freed. A snare has no effect on formless or Large or larger creatures. A creature can use its action to make a DC 16 Strength or Dexterity check (the target chooses the ability to use), freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The snare has an AC of 13, 20 hit points, immunity to all damage not dealt by melee weapons, and resistance to damage dealt by unenhanced melee weapons. Destroying the snare frees the creature without harming it and immediately ends the snare's effects.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 13 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 1, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk II
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 14 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 2, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk III
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 15 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 3, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk IV
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 16 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 4, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk V
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 17 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases by 5, to a maximum of 18.

item.name: Sonorous Oscillator Mk VI
entries: This weapon gains the sonorous 18 property. If it already has the sonorous property, its sonorous number increases to 18.

item.name: Sorcerer's Adrenal (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +1 bonus to its damage and healing rolls with force powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Sorcerer's Adrenal (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +1 bonus to its force attack rolls, force save DC, and damage and healing rolls with force powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Sorcerer's Adrenal (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +2 bonus to its force attack rolls, force save DC, and damage and healing rolls with force powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Sorcerer's Adrenal (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target gains a +3 bonus to its force attack rolls, force save DC, and damage and healing rolls with force powers. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Sparkles
entries: When you roll a 20 on an attack roll with this weapon, or hit a creature that has not yet acted during your first turn in combat, you deal an additional 1d4 energy damage.  {@i Sparkles is a BlasTech CS-14 light pistol owned by the mercenary Corso Riggs during the Galactic Cold War.}

item.name: Spicebrew
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by 2d3. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, their current and maximum force points are reduced by 2d3. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Aged)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by 2d8. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by 2d8. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Fine)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by 2d4. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum force points are reduced by 2d4. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Matured)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by 2d6. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, their current and maximum force points are reduced by 2d6. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Reserve)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by 2d10. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by 2d10. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spicebrew (Special)
entries: Spicebrew, a popular drink across the galaxy, is a tanned alcoholic beverage topped with foam. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next hour, the creature experiences a high that increases their current and maximum force points by 2d12. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 24 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 8 hours, their current and maximum force points are reduced by 2d12. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Spiked Shielding
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield} This shield gains the spiked (1d4) property. If it already has the spiked property, the spiked damage increases by one step (from d4 to d6, or from d6 to d8).

item.name: Spiked Shielding Mk II
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield} This shield gains the spiked (1d6) property. If it already has the spiked property, the spiked damage increases by two steps (from d4 to d8).

item.name: Spiked Shielding Mk III
entries: {@i {@b Prerequiste:} Shield} This shield gains the spiked (1d8) property. If it already has the spiked property, the spiked damage increases to d8.

item.name: Stabilizer Ascendancy Cell
entries: This weapon loses the dexterity property.

item.name: Stabilizer Dueling Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by three steps (from 21 to 15, 19 to 13, or 17 to 11). If the dexterity number is 15 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Stabilizer Fighting Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by two steps (from 21 to 17, 19 to 15, 17 to 13, or 15 to 11). If the dexterity number is 13 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Stabilizer Mastery Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by four steps (from 21 to 13 or 19 to 11). If the dexterity number is 17 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Stabilizer Supremacy Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by five steps (from 21 to 11). If the dexterity number is 19 or lower, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Stabilizer Training Cell
entries: This weapon's dexterity number is reduced by one step (from 21 to 19, 19 to 17, 17 to 15, 15 to 13, or 13 to 11). If the dexterity number is 11, this modification removes the dexterity property from it entirely.

item.name: Staggering Oscillator
entries: When you hit with the weapon, you can force the target to make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed back 10 feet and knocked prone.  Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 10. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 60. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 50. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 20. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 30. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Stamina Adrenal (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this adrenal to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this adrenal, the target's current and maximum hit points increase by 40. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can benefit from only one adrenal at a time.

item.name: Steadfast Reinforcement
entries: This armor or shield gains the steadfast property.

item.name: Stealth field generator
entries: Stealth field generators are special devices typically worn on belts that function as a portable, personal cloaking device. Activating or deactivating the generator requires a bonus action and, while active, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) ability checks that rely on sight. The generator lasts for 1 minute and can be recharged by a power source or replacing the power cell. This effect ends early if you make an attack or cast a force- or tech- power.

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Stealth increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Choice)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Stealth increases by four steps (to mastery, from trained to high mastery, or from proficient to grand mastery).

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Elite)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Stealth increases by five steps (to high mastery or from trained to grand mastery).

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Exquisite)
entries: You gain grand mastery in Stealth.

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Favored)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Stealth increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Stealthy Pattern (Fine)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Stealth increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Stitching Amplifier Mk I
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee tech attacks and a -1 penalty to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Stitching Amplifier Mk II
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Stitching Amplifier Mk III
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Stitching Amplifier Mk IV
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Stitching Rangefinder Mk I
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged tech attacks and a -1 penalty to melee tech attacks.

item.name: Stitching Rangefinder Mk II
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +1 bonus to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Stitching Rangefinder Mk III
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Stitching Rangefinder Mk IV
entries: While using this item as your focus, you gain a +3 bonus to ranged tech attacks.

item.name: Storing Dataport (Basic)
entries: This item gains the storing 1 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 1, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Dataport (Champion)
entries: This item gains the storing 6 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases to 6.

item.name: Storing Dataport (Exceptional)
entries: This item gains the storing 5 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 5, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Dataport (Fine)
entries: This item gains the storing 2 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 2, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Dataport (Improved)
entries: This item gains the storing 3 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 3, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Dataport (Superior)
entries: This item gains the storing 4 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Emitter (Basic)
entries: This item gains the storing 1 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 1, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Emitter (Champion)
entries: This item gains the storing 6 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases to 6.

item.name: Storing Emitter (Exceptional)
entries: This item gains the storing 5 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 5, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Emitter (Fine)
entries: This item gains the storing 2 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 2, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Emitter (Improved)
entries: This item gains the storing 3 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 3, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Storing Emitter (Superior)
entries: This item gains the storing 4 property. If it already has the storing property, its storing number increases by 4, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Strength Augment (Basic)
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1. One ability score other than Strength (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Strength Augment (Champion)
entries: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 2.

item.name: Strength Augment (Exceptional)
entries: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Strength Augment (Fine)
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1.

item.name: Strength Augment (Improved)
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1. One ability score other than Strength (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Strength Augment (Superior)
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1, and your maximum for this score increases by 1.

item.name: Strength Enhancement (Basic)
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.  {@b Side Effect:} One ability score other than Strength (chosen by the GM) decreases by 1.

item.name: Strength Enhancer
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score becomes 21. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 21, it has no effect on you.  {@i This belt increases a users physical power with pneumaticized assistance joists that provide support and leverage in a minimal form-factor.}

item.name: Strength Stim (Basic)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Strength score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Strength Stim (Champion)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Strength score increases by 10, and its maximum for this score increases by 10. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Strength Stim (Exceptional)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Strength score increases by 8, and its maximum for this score increases by 8. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Strength Stim (Fine)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Strength score increases by 2, and its maximum for this score increases by 2. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Strength Stim (Improved)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Strength score increases by 4, and its maximum for this score increases by 4. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Strength Stim (Superior)
entries: As an action, you can administer this stimpac to a creature within 5 feet. When you administer this stimpac, the target's Strength score increases by 6, and its maximum for this score increases by 6. This effect lasts for 1 hour. A creature can benefit from only one stimpac at a time.

item.name: Strength Weave (Basic)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Strength saving throws increases by one step (to trained, from trained to proficient, from proficient to expertise, from expertise to mastery, from mastery to high mastery, or from high mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Strength Weave (Exceptional)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Strength saving throws increases by three steps (to expertise, from trained to mastery, from proficient to high mastery, or from expertise to grand mastery).

item.name: Strength Weave (Improved)
entries: Your level of proficiency in Strength saving throws increases by two steps (to proficient, from trained to expertise, from proficient to mastery, from expertise to high mastery, or from mastery to grand mastery).

item.name: Stylus pen
entries: A stylus pen is designed to write on both solid surfaces and touch screen interfaces.

item.name: Sunshades
entries: These shades are worn over the eyes. While worn, you can no longer have disadvantage due to direct sunlight on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight. However, while worn, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in dim light.

item.name: Surging Processor Mk I
entries: This item gains the surging 1 property. If it already has the surging property, its surging number increases by 1, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Surging Processor Mk II
entries: This item gains the surging 2 property. If it already has the surging property, its surging number increases by 2, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Surging Processor Mk III
entries: This item gains the surging 3 property. If it already has the surging property, its surging number increases by 3, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Surging Processor Mk IV
entries: This item gains the surging 4 property. If it already has the surging property, its surging number increases by 4, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Surging Processor Mk V
entries: This item gains the surging 5 property. If it already has the surging property, its surging number increases by 5, to a maximum of 6.

item.name: Surging Processor Mk VI
entries: This item gains the surging 6 property. If it already has the surging property, its surging number increases to 6.

item.name: Surveillance Implant
entries: This augmentation replaces your face.  This implant includes a headcomm with a scrambler that automatically encodes messages sent to a specified recipient commlink or receiver.  {@b Side Effect:} You can not use portable personal devices used for communication or jamming, such as a commlink or holotrace device, due to interference with this implant.  {@i This augmentation appears as a crescent around one eye paired with two small dots above the eyebrow.}

item.name: Survival and Surveillance Implant
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes and face.  This implant contains several tools for long-term survival and reconnaissance. As a bonus action, you can activate one of the below modes that enable you to use several of these tools at once. Only one mode can be active at a time. {@i }{@i  - {@b Communications Mode:} This communications suite includes a headcomm with a scrambler that automatically encodes messages sent to a specified recipient commlink or receiver. While this mode is active, you cannot be deafened. - {@b Interceptor Mode:} This is a jamming and electronic warfare suite that includes a comm jammer, a holotrace device and pocket scrambler. - {@b Respirator Mode:} This includes a basic respirator that grants advantage on saving throws made to avoid being poisoned and resistance to poison damage.   {@b Side Effect:} This complex interface causes significant interference with other communication devices, rendering them impossible to use. While this implant is installed, you can not use any portable device used for communication or jamming, such as a commlink or holotrace device.  }Frequently used by scouts and corporate espionage specialists, this imposing implant covers nearly the entire left half of the face, and includes a series of tools for long-term survival in hostile conditions._

item.name: Survival and Surveillance Implant Mk II
entries: This augmentation replaces your eyes and face.  This implant contains several improved tools for long-term survival and reconnaissance. As a bonus action, you can activate one of the below modes that enable you to use several of these tools at once. Only one mode can be active at a time. {@i }{@i  - {@b Communications Mode:} This communications suite includes a headcomm with a scrambler that automatically encodes messages sent to a specified recipient commlink or receiver. While this mode is active, you cannot be deafened. Additionally, if you listen to any spoken language for 10 minutes, the software in this package will begin to attempt to decipher it. Make an Intelligence (Lore) check, DC determined by the GM depending on the rarity of the language. On a success, you can understand the spoken form of this language, and speak it if your species' vocal capabilities allow for it. - {@b Interceptor Mode:} This is a jamming and electronic warfare suite that includes a comm jammer, a holotrace device and pocket scrambler. Additionally, you can attempt to listen in on nearby audio communications chatter such as from a comlink or holocomm as an action. Make an Intelligence (Technology) check, DC determined by the GM depending on the sophistication of the technology. On a success, you can hear electronic communications originating from within 100 feet. - {@b Respirator Mode:} This includes a basic respirator that grants advantage on saving throws made to avoid being poisoned and resistance to poison damage. Additionally, you do not need air to breathe, allowing you to survive even in vacuum for up to 1 hour.  {@b Side Effect:} This complex interface causes significant interference with other communication devices, rendering them impossible to use. While this implant is installed, you can not use any portable device used for communication or jamming, such as a commlink or holotrace device.  }This sleek, stark white device adorned with a small antenna attaches to the back of the otherwise bulky S3 module._

item.name: T-Cycle Reinforcer (Basic)
entries: When you cast a force power that pushes or pulls a creature, you can increase the distance pushed or pulled by 5 feet.

item.name: T-Cycle Reinforcer (Improved)
entries: When you cast a force power that pushes or pulls a creature, you can increase the distance pushed or pulled by 10 feet.

item.name: Tankard
entries: A tankard stores 1 pint of liquid.

item.name: Taozin Amulet
entries: While wearing this amulet, you are hidden from detection through the Force. You can't be targeted by force powers or features that would detect the presence of the Force in you, and features that would detect your attunement to the Force show you glowing a faint yellow.  {@i Made from the skin of a taozin, this amulet blurs and clouds Force senses so their wearers can not easily be detected by another Force-sensitive.}

item.name: Telgorn Jolt Stabilizer (Improved)
entries: When you cast a force power or use a class feature that requires a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 force point to change the weapon's damage type to lightning and deal an additional 1d8 lightning damage.

item.name: Thermal Detonator (Average)
entries: Thermal detonators are unique in that can only be turned off by whoever turned them on. They can be set to detonate on impact or with a timer that causes them to explode on initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties). As an action, you can prime and throw a grenade at a point you can see within 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. Each creature within 20 feet must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 4d6 fire and 4d10 kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.

item.name: Thermal Detonator (Deadly)
entries: Thermal detonators are unique in that can only be turned off by whoever turned them on. They can be set to detonate on impact or with a timer that causes them to explode on initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties). As an action, you can prime and throw a grenade at a point you can see within 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. Each creature within 20 feet must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 fire and 8d10 kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.

item.name: Tihaar
entries: This colorless spirit, favored by Mandalorians, burns the mouth and throat when consumed. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d3 when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains 2d3 temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a d3 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d3. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

entries: This colorless spirit, favored by Mandalorians, burns the mouth and throat when consumed. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d8 when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and at the start of each of the creature's turns it gains 2d8 temporary hit points. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a d8 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d8. If this would reduce your maximum hit points below 1, it instead becomes 1. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 1 hour, during which they must roll a d4 and subtract the result when making an ability check or saving throw using Constitution, and for the duration their current and maximum hit points are reduced by 2d4. item.name: Tool Integration
entries: One tool of your choice in which you are proficient is integrated into your chassis.

item.name: Torchy
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this enhanced weapon, and when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack using this weapon, the creature takes an extra 1d4 energy damage for each size category larger than you it is (up to 3d4 extra damage).  {@i Torchy is a BlasTech ALT-25 blaster pistol owned by the mercenary Corso Riggs during the Galactic Cold War.}

item.name: Torpedo Launcher (Fine)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, the damage of torpedoes fired by this weapon increases by one step (from d4 to d6, d6 to d8, d8 to d10, d10 to d12, or d12 to d20). If this would increase the damage die above a d20, instead add an additional five dice to the torpedo's damage for each step above a d20.

item.name: Torpedo Launcher (Improved)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, the damage of torpedoes fired by this weapon increases by two steps (from d4 to d8, d6 to d10, d8 to d12, or d10 to d20). If this would increase the damage die above a d20, instead add an additional five dice to the torpedo's damage for each step above a d20.

item.name: Torpedo Launcher (Superior)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced weapon. Additionally, the damage of torpedoes fired by this weapon increases by three steps (from d4 to d10, d6 to d12, or d8 to d20). If this would increase the damage die above a d20, instead add an additional five dice to the torpedo's damage for each step above a d20.

item.name: Torpedo launcher
entries:
Rather than traditional power cells, the torpedo launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of torpedoes. Torpedo launchers have advantage on attack rolls against Gargantuan creatures and disadvantage on attack rolls against Large and smaller creatures. Unlike other weapons, the torpedo launcher can only be loaded using an action, and you donâ€™t add your Dexterity modifier to damage rolls you make with it.

The torpedo launcher requires the use of a tripod, which is included in the price. Over the course of 1 minute, you can deploy or collapse the torpedo launcher on the tripod. While deployed, your speed is reduced to 0.

item.name: Torpedo, Fragmentation (Average)
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced torpedo launcher ammunition, which deals 20d6 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Fragmentation (Deadly)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced torpedo launcher ammunition, which deals 20d10 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Fragmentation (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced torpedo launcher ammunition, which deals 20d20 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this enhanced torpedo launcher ammunition, which deals 20d12 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Plasma (Devastating)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced torpedo launcher ammunition, which deals 20d20 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the power generator is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Plasma (Lethal)
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced torpedo launcher ammunition, which deals 20d12 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Torpedo, Plasma (Major)
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this enhanced torpedo launcher ammunition, which deals 20d8 kinetic damage on a hit. This bonus is in addition to any bonuses granted by the weapon. Once the torpedo is depleted, it no longer gives a bonus.

item.name: Tracker utility vest
entries: A utility vest is a sleeveless item of clothing that includes several evenly-distributed pockets, popular among hunters, smugglers, and adventurers. The vest is made of leathery, hide material to resist rips, corrosion and water. The wearer can carry up to 10 light items (up to 1.00 lb each) without increasing their total encumbrance.

item.name: Tranquilizer rifle
entries: The tranquilizer rifle includes a specialized compartment for poison. One dose of poison, when installed in this compartment, retains its potency for 1 hour before drying. One dose of poison is effective for the next 4 shots fired by the weapon. Additionally, creatures reduced to 0 hit points by this weapon are immediately stabilized, unless that damage would instantly kill them.

item.name: Trapper's kit
entries: Trapper's kits can create, disarm, and disassemble traps.

item.name: Traumakit
entries: A common traumakit can be stocked with bacta packs, and contains spray-bandages, bone stabilizers, antiseptics, and other essentials for the treatment of wounds. As an action, you can expend a use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check. A traumakit can be used to stabilize 5 times before it must be restocked at its original cost.

item.name: Tripod
entries: A tripod is a device used to mount a two-handed blaster weapon to offer increased stability. Over the course of 1 minute, you can deploy or collapse the tripod. While deployed, you ignore the Strength requirement on the attached blaster weapon with the strength property, and your speed is reduced to 0. Additionally, while deployed, you have a +10 bonus to ability checks and saving throws to avoid being disarmed of the weapon.

item.name: Tsiraki
entries: Tsiraki is a blue-colored alcoholic beverage crafted from fermented salakberries and pickling spices. As an action, you can apply this substance to a creature within 5 feet. For the next minute, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d3 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 10 minutes, during which they must roll a d3 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

For the next 10 minutes, the creature experiences a high that allows them to roll an additional d8 when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the high, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or experience a low that lasts 4 hours, during which they must roll a d8 and subtract the result when making an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Charisma. At the end of the low, the creature must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw to resist addiction.

item.name: Tunic Chassis (Advanced)
entries: This modifiable clothing chassis comes with vacant modification slots for clothing modifications, as well as one augment slot. It can house modifications of advanced rarity or lower.

item.name: Tunic Chassis (Artifact)
